metadata.title: CVE-2019-11048 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In PHP versions 7.2.x below 7.2.31, 7.3.x below 7.3.18 and 7.4.x below7.4.6, when HTTP file uploads are allowed, supplying overly long filenamesor field names could lead PHP engine to try to allocate oversized memorystorage, hit the memory limit and stop processing the request, withoutcleaning up temporary files created by upload request. This potentiallycould lead to accumulation of uncleaned temporary files exhausting the diskspace on the target server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11048` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12

php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-recode - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-snmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12

php5-xmlrpc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm12').
